page.title: 06TRESWELL VILLAGE
page.content: The origin of this village name is derived from 'three wells' that once existed for drinking water. Treswell is a rural village with most of it's houses set along Main Street. In Treswell there is a garage with shop, and a public house. There is an active village community. 'Taskers' is a club run for young children. We play games, make things and have Bible studies. It is held in the chapel. There is a ladies' rounders team, a horticultural society and a village committee which runs a summer gala.Volunteers in the village run a summer club during the school holidays and a Christmas party is held for the children and the old folks. Whist drives, bingo and Women's Institute meetings are held in the village hall.
